title: Serpent, brazen
content: Made by Moses at God’s command to be a sacramental means of healing for the Israelites in the wilderness (
). It seems to have been carefully preserved and became an object of superstitious worship (
); it was accordingly destroyed by Hezekiah, who called it “Nehushtan.” The “lifting up” of the serpent in the wilderness is referred to by the Lord as a type of His own “lifting up” upon the cross (
). Latter-day revelation confirms the episode of the fiery serpents and the healing properties associated with looking upon Moses’ brazen serpent (
